intro: Napeanthus subacaulis var. integer, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed napeanthus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, almost stemless appearance, with leaves that are typically smooth and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
